page.title: 03THE HARTLEY PIT DISASTER.
page.content: On January 16th,1862 an appalling disaster occurred at the {Hester Pit}, New Hartley.This was the Hartley Pit Disaster,in which over{200 miners} died by being buried alive.There was only one shaft divided into upcast and downcast shafts by a{wooden brattice.} The beam of the most powerful engine in the north of England was over the mouth of the shaft. As the shifts were changing, almost the whole male population were down the pit when the pumping beam broke sending{23 tons}of iron crashing down to seal the shaft. Men worked until Wednesday, Jan.21st. to release the trapped men but by the time they broke through every entombed man had succumbed to the deadly{stythe}or choke-damp. The bodies were laid to rest in{Earsdon {Churchyard.}
